H0.text: where did the british empire control an entire continent. Africa

H1.text: where did the british empire control an entire continent. North America

H2.text: where did the british empire control an entire continent. South America

H3.text: where did the british empire control an entire continent. Australia

A4.text: The British claim was extended to the whole Australian continent in 1827 when Major Edmund Lockyer established a settlement on King George Sound (modern-day Albany).

A5.text: By the mid-19th century, most of the continent had been explored by European settlers and five additional self-governing British colonies were established, each gaining responsible government by 1890.
